channel.title: Tools on Hack Me Daddy
channel.description: Recent content in Tools on Hack Me Daddy

item.title: Gobuster
item.description:
Used For: Directory Busting

GoBuster is a versatile tool that allows for performing DNS, vhost, and directory brute-forcing. The tool has additional functionality, such as enumeration of public AWS S3 buckets. For this module’s purposes, we are interested in the directory (and file) brute-forcing modes specified with the switch dir. Let us run a simple scan using the dirb common.txt wordlist.

Command Cheat Sheet:

  • Dirbusting:

    • Command: gobuster dir -u <http://> -w <wordlist>
    • Example: gobuster dir -u <http://> -w /usr/share/wordlist/dirb/common.txt

  • DNS Busting:

item.title: SCP
item.description:
Overview:

scp plaintext@192.168.49.128:/root/myroot.txt .

  • scp: scp stands for “secure copy” and is a command-line tool used to securely transfer files between local and remote systems.

  • plaintext@192.168.49.128: This specifies the username and IP address of the remote system you want to connect to. In this case, the username is plaintext, and the IP address is 192.168.49.128. You may need to replace plaintext with the appropriate username.

  • :/root/myroot.txt: This is the path of the file on the remote system that you want to copy. In this case, it’s /root/myroot.txt. This assumes that the file myroot.txt is located in the /root directory on the remote system. Adjust the path according to your specific file location.
